intro: Mentha albarracinensis, commonly known as the Albarracín mint, is a rare species of flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic, serrated leaves and purple flowers. This plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is distinguished by its unique chemical composition, which includes various essential oils responsible for its strong minty fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Mentha albarracinensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
